name: FreeSurfer-Recon-all-directives
command-line: export SUBJECTS_DIR=$PWD && export FS_LICENSE=$PWD/[LICENSE_FILE] && SUBJFOLDER=$(basename [SUBJID]) && SUBJFOLDER=${SUBJFOLDER%.tar.gz} && SUBJFOLDER=${SUBJFOLDER%.tgz} && [ -d "$SUBJFOLDER" ] || tar -xzf [SUBJID] -C . && recon-all -s "$SUBJFOLDER" [DIRECTIVES] [QCACHE] [MPRAGE] [3T] [CW256] [NOTAL-CHECK] [BRAINSTEM-STRUCTURES] [NO-WSGCAATLAS] [NO-SKULLSTRIP] && tar -czvf [RESULTS] "$SUBJFOLDER"
author: Laboratory for Computational Neuroimaging

output-files.name: Output
output-files.description: The subject data upon which to operate

inputs.name: License file
inputs.description: Valid license file needed to run FreeSurfer.

inputs.name: qcache
inputs.description: Produce the pre-cached files required by the Qdec utility, allowing rapid analysis of group data.

inputs.name: mprage
inputs.description: Assume scan parameters are MGH MP-RAGE protocol.

inputs.name: 3T
inputs.description: The -3T flag enables two specific options in recon-all for images acquired with a 3T scanner:  3T-specific NU intensity correction parameters are used in the Non-Uniform normalization stage, and the Schwartz 3T atlas is used for Talairach alignment

inputs.name: cw256
inputs.description: Include this flag after -autorecon1 if images have a FOV > 256.

inputs.name: Notal check
inputs.description: Skip the automatic failure detection of Talairach alignment.

inputs.name: No wsgcaatlas
inputs.description: Do not use GCA atlas when skull stripping.

description: Performs all, or any part of, the FreeSurfer cortical reconstruction process (https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/fswiki/recon-all).
